title: YSK: When submitting your mail-in ballot, make sure your signature matches your most recent state ID or what was used at registration. This is frequently used to reject ballots.
selftext:
https://readthefingdirections.com/

https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/08/25/how-prevent-your-mail-ballot-being-rejected/

https://www.aclu.org/blog/voting-rights/signature-match-laws-disproportionately-impact-voters-already-margins

https://www.ncsl.org/research/elections-and-campaigns/vopp-table-15-states-that-permit-voters-to-correct-signature-discrepancies.aspx

See also: John Oliver's segment from a few days ago

https://youtu.be/AytDzZ2ecCc?t=704

Make sure to **vote early** and check the status of your ballot, since some states are required to notify you if it doesn't go through (see last link in the above list). Some like California allow you to vote in person instead even if you've already gotten a mail-in ballot, so that is an option as well.
